events.title: D-Day: Allied Invasion of Normandy
events.description: On June 6, 1944, during World War II, Allied forces launched a massive amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy, France, marking the beginning of the liberation of Western Europe from Nazi occupation.
events.significance: This operation, known as D-Day, was a pivotal turning point in World War II, leading to the eventual defeat of Nazi Germany.

events.title: Gustav Vasa Elected King of Sweden
events.description: Gustav Vasa was elected King of Sweden on June 6, 1523, marking the foundation of modern Sweden and the end of the Kalmar Union with Denmark and Norway.
events.significance: His election paved the way for the establishment of Swedish independence and significant political and religious reforms.

events.title: Charles Darwin Dies
events.description: Charles Darwin, the British naturalist known for his theory of evolution by natural selection, died on June 6, 1882.
events.significance: Darwin's work fundamentally changed biological sciences and shaped our understanding of life on Earth.

events.title: Assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy
events.description: Robert F. Kennedy was assassinated on June 6, 1968, shortly after winning the California presidential primary.
events.significance: His death was a major shock to the US political landscape during a period of social unrest and deeply affected the 1968 presidential election.
